page.title: 14Wellworthy Ltd. 1
page.content: { Wellworthy}was registered as an official trade name in 1919 when John Howlett began to expand his piston manufacturing company formally known as South Coast Garages. Wellworthy = "Well" from "Priestlands{Well}" site + "worthy"=old Wessex name for a ring around a well. At this time the area was almost completely rural with yacht building the only industry. The site on Lyndhurst Road, originally Ampress Farm, was bought by Wellworthy in 1939. It is{35 acres}in size including large sports grounds. The main products are{pistons}and {piston rings}which are made at most of the 5 factories all situated in the South and West of England. Since the closure of the Stanford Rd. site in Lymington the Ampress site has become the head office. There are 2,500 employees at this plant.
